job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: I was PRN - not full time, no option for that. Great people to work with Easy job Decent pay
cons: Will take advantage of you if you show the ability to work hard aka first shift will leave all the work to be done for second shift technicians and then second shift technicians have to get the third shift technician prepared. 3 shifts in an 8 hour time frame. I was PRN and they worked me full-time. Would threaten to write me up if i refused to work a shift. Mandatory *** every other weekend. I worked there 4 years and was promised a raise every year, never received one.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician I (MLT) in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: If your a terrible employee this is the place for you, show up when ya want, leave when ya want, and call in as often as you like. Nothing will be done about it!
cons: Schedules are posted and then taken down to make changes, but they don't tell you they changed it, management is unseen, unheard, and not respected due to a massive amount of disorganization. Noone likes their job or smiles. Pay is more than $5/hr less than any surrounding hospitals so there is also unsafe staffing!

pros: They did pay me for my time. Hastled me about everything though. Rude and demeaning.
cons: Management is awful. They lie use and abuse. The hospital is trash. Everything is broken. 0 stars. Would not recommend.

job_title: Patient Registration Representative in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: Flexibility, great coworkers, team effort
cons: Favoritism, management, inconsistency in communication

pros: The pros about working at Clark is the people. These are the nicest people you’ll ever meet. Everyone you walk pass or come in contact with is the nicest, sweetest people you will ever meet. They are caring and they will help in anyway.
cons: The downside about working at Clark is they are badly understaffed. People are leaving everyday.  They told me I would me doing one thing in the interview, when I started I was doing the job of 4-5 people for $13.00. It was a lady that had been there for 15 years she constantly complained about her pay rate & the fact that she could never take a day off cause there is no one to do her job. The supervisor had only been there 4 months, she had no idea what the work even consisted of. She was training too. They had about 5 people quit before I started and I see why! A week after I started another girl found a new job. They don’t pay enough to do multiple jobs.  Nobody really understands what they do. I wouldn’t be surprised if they did away with some of those jobs because registration can’t do them easily. It’s repetitive & unnecessary.

review_title: So far this has been a good fit for me. Smallish community hospital with high quality and evidence based care.
job_title: Director of Nursing Critical Care in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: Sincere staff and administration that is accessible and responsive. I have the ability to be creative and use my strengths here which I appreciate.
cons: Salaries are not market competitive for bedside staff although HR has been creative in trying to come up with complete packages which try to make up the difference. Sometimes leadership can be reactive as opposed to proactive.

pros: I have a very flexible schedule, in fact I make my own, and only work every third weekend.  For the most part we all get along very well.
cons: The benefits are being scaled back as with most places you work any more.  My raises rarely make up for the increase in my insurance.

pros: This place has nothing but room for improvement so I guess a pro is there's only one way to go.
cons: Scary place to work. And imagine it's even scarier as a patient. Privacy, confidentiality, infection control, etc seem to have not caught on here yet. My time here was very short lived because I can't work under such unethical and terrible conditions.

pros: Great pay for nurse aides and great training. Would love to work here again in the future. They provide several opportunities to enhance and learn new clinical skills.
cons: Management in all med/surge areas seem to be a revolving door. Not sure why.

pros: Excellent management to physician relations. Dedication to service and quality. Transparency and communication that sets the company above others.
cons: Recent transition period as acquisition was completed was challenging, but now significant improvement on the horizon.

review_title: Great for patients, not so much for employees
pros: Small enough to react quickly to issues, excellent medical care
cons: pinching pennies has caught up and now salaries are out of alignment with area. Partnership with Norton's Healthcare looming

pros: small town atmosphere and exceptional ER department
cons: benefits are not known to be the best, politics in gaining advancement

review_title: Avoid if interested in fulfilling career
pros: We cannot think of a single Pro.
cons: Poor compensation,  poor benefits,  poor upper level leadership that is lead by the nose of corporate owner Lifepoint down in Nashville.  Only here to fulfill commitment then out. Much greener pastures within 5 minutes of this place.
